lick yesterday i took out  foxtails from my dogs paw and he is still licking  i looked and there is alittle cut so i wrapped and put skin soother from natural dog company  he seems calm now and not trying to lick at it anymore

whine i have a yr old anatolian shepherd lbs and is getting increasingly more anxious and panicky when there is even the slightest bit of thunder i give her  gabapentin and trazadone when i know its going to storm i have a thunder vest that plays music i have a closet and a kennel she can go into to feel safe when she starts freaking out she will whine start pacing and even bark at us for i guess attention but im not really sure what im supposed to do i try not to coddle or pet her because ive read its rewarding the panic behavior i try to just pretend everything is normal but honestly its so hard to watch when i can feel her anxiety and its sad to see her like that is there anything else you all do for your storm anxious pups that helps whine

growl i own two dogs male and female both are incredibly sweet dogs but the male growls at me usually whenever i go near him when hes got a toy or food he doesnt bite but definitely gets pissed the female never has once growled at me though i can take food from her mouth annoy her with cuddles no matter what it is shes never once snapped at me all the animals ive owned have always been sweet but they have their limits just like any other animal but she doesnt seem to be bothered by anything really just thought it was weird compared to the cats and dogs ive owned growl

whine i have a yearold jack russel terrier and his behavior has changed ever since we moved 

he will come up to me and make whiny noises but when i pet him to calm him down his whining intensifies to a point where hes barking loudly at me he will just look me in the eye and bark 

his food and water dishes are constantly full he doesnt want to go outside when i open the door nothing he just wants to bark at me for some reason 

at that point i pull back and shun him to show that i dont approve of that behavior he used to chill out and sit next to me but now hes getting too riled up 

this has been going on for quite some time and weve been having a hard time bonding because he would become too excited im afraid of him being depressed since hes been lying around he used to play hard to get with me but now he wont calm down

how do i teach him to calm down when i pet him like before whine

bark i have a  month old german shepard puppy she is the light of my life  i take her to the dog park every day and bring along a bag that i put water a little metal bowl to hold the water and some toys in case shes there alone 

today while walking back from the park she saw another dog and got very excited and was pulling on the leash and jumping and barking  i went to reach over to grab the back of her harness to calm her down and the bag with her things in it swung and hit her in her mouth she made a little crying sound but carried on barking i immediately felt horrible and gave her some water and checked her mouth  theres a little bit of blood on her side two teeth  

i feel horrible absolutely horrible  ive been petting her and apologizing profusely  it was an accident  should i take her to the vet bark

bark he was a good boy he was a tough guy too he towered a few inches over all the lhasa apsos we came across i will miss his sharp assertive lhasaapso bark i will wonder where he will be when i expect him to come into my room and be clingy as usual i will miss sitting out on the porch with him or driving him around the neighborhood especially when he became too old for long walks 

he saved my life once i battled a brain tumor  years ago i had passed out unconscious on the floor after a lot of pain all alone he licked my face and barked to wake me up several hours later 

he was my mom and sisters emotional support my dads best friend and my little guardian angel

everyone who met him loved him even the cat people loved him  

i miss bandito so much im just happy he isnt suffering he deserves to rest bark

whine hey all so my family dog named trix has gone fully deaf and blind i dont live in my family home anymore but im here for another two weeks or so before i leave i want to get some sort of system and routine set up 

some information that might be helpful 
there are three children in the house one in middle school one in highschool and one in kindergarten 
we have stairs and a pool 
one other dog otherwise no pets 
the two adults have jobs one as a teacher and one as a professor 
the dogs are not crate trained 

right now trix is very cautious he has already fallen in the pool once and needed saving he whines a lot at the bottom of the stairs in general he seems very confused 

any advice or recommended resources would be greatly appreciated whine

bark ever since i was  years old ive had the most loyal kindest and most caring dog anyone could ever ask for she would follow me around all the time and anytime my big dog came to me she would protect me and bark at him whenever i would climb my backyard walls as a kid she would go crazy until i would get down every time i cried she came and supported me licking off my tears i slept and cuddled with her every night and she was like my best friend i came home from school today to find out she passed peacefully i dont know what to do i feel so lonely and lost without her i dont know what to do i just want her back bark

play hi everyone  years ago i got my little dog atreus and he became best friends with my old boy bronson instantly atreus gave bronson an extra couple of years on his life helping him be active and slim down to be healthy they were inseparable and were always playing together  days ago bronson passed away at  and a half years old and little atreus has stepped up and matured a lot already 

bronson was the happiest and calmest dog always smiling playing and shaking hands just a beautiful soul he passed shaking my hand and smiling now hes forever smiling looking over us

atreus on the other hand is a crazy boy always smiling incredibly smart never runs out of steam and loves to chew everything and jump in the pool even in the winter bronson never liked the water he was always bronsons shadow and looked up to him and followed him everywhere now hes the one taking charge

bronson is in the nd and rd photos and atreus in the th and th play

bark my rescue who i rescued last year has become overprotective and violent initially he only barked at people entering our house but now he attacks them if they move or even stand up some people he likes and doesnt bark at them or attack them it scares me and my family since hes so great with us and we dont want to give him up we dont like to lock him up when guests and family members visit but we have no choice but to do so now there are no dog schools near me what should i do to train him bark

growl i have two dogs one is  and one is  they have been best buddies since we got the  year old neither are very dominant 

 year old had an episode about a month ago and he has been a lot more fragile since hes still seems comfortable and is eating and drinking normally so we havent looked into any end of life options yet 

since the episode the  year old will randomly run at and growl and nip the  year old he wont actually bite him but he is being very unfriendly yesterday he rammed the  year old into a wall the  year old is a pretty jealous and neurotic pup so im wondering if its just jealously or is it some animalistic type of end of life dominance 

has anyone seen anything like this any advice they still sleep together walk together the majority of the day until the  year old strikes at random and the  year old doesnt react at all when attacked growl

bark does anyone have suggestions for a dog that wont stop barking for no reason i have an older chihuahua mix who started barking about a year ago usually late afternoon i dont know if he sundowns or has dementiai can usually calm him down when im home so i thought some of it was separation anxiety ive taken him to the vet a couple of times he has prozac and gabapentin but its not helping ive tried multiple calming treats a thunder shirt and trazadone but no luck my husband works from home and the dog will just start high pitched nonstop howl barking for no reason and now he starts it the morning and goes all day so its very disruptive i dont know what else to try and my vet seems at a loss as well bark

jump it drives me absolutely insane we adopted him about    years ago his name is chronos and he is a  yr old boxerpitt mix he has been around them since day one but every noise they make even if its not near them he jumps they can be two rooms over and jump out of the litter box and he jumps up like something is going to attack him i know he has to have some sort of trauma from his short life in the animal shelter and on the outside prior to us but is there anything we can do he isnt violent never attacked the cats or even acted like he was going to its more a scare response than anything jump

fetch i was playing fetch with my dog and he was totally normal then he catches the ball and immediately spits it out and starts licking his lips and bobbing his head he then ignores my command to get the ball hes usually crazy about the ball and would never ignore it he then acted anxious to go back in

when i took him back in he then wanted to go out so i let him he immediately started eating grass

why did this suddenly happen could the ball have hit his uvula and caused him nausea weve been to the vet a bunch lately because of his vomiting and they said hes fine and he hasnt had stomach problems for a week hes never acted this way any ideas fetch

tail wag hi our puppies are  weeks old we started slowly introducing them to their dad about a week ago hes reaction has been great wagging tail patience etc only behaviour im not sure about is he stops them from fighting if they are fighting amongst themselves he goes to stop them because of this we dont keep them around him for two long
when they cry in the mothers kennel he always goes to check on them and lick them through the barrier

so i was surprised when he started spraying in the house last night and today especially where the puppies play hes very well trained and never uses toilet in the house

worried its anxiety or stress all puppies are males can anyone give some input to what they think is normal behaviour how we can stop him spraying andwhether or not its ok for us to get the puppies and him to spend lots of time together and how

hes the brown dog in this family picture tail wag

bark i have an  year old havanese dog that barks at the bell and when we get home this from excitement we live in an apartment complex we left her alone for  hours this evening and when we got home the neighbors came to knock on our door and wanted to call the police because of the barking we got home around  how do we stop her from barking while were gone well try closing the windows but shes a very anxious dog and i fear shell bark anyways my theory is they knocked on the door while we were gone and scared her making her bark even more but the neighbor could also be exaggerating were usually home during the day home office but once a week shes alone for  hours while im in the office when were gone for more than  hours i bring her to my parents house but we dont always have that option im desperate please help i really want her to be able to stay here but we also cant have trouble with our neighbors tia bark

growl i had a situation going on at home and not really sure what kind of training my dog milo needs he is a  year old morkie recently hes been really aggressive to my other small dog peanut who is a  year old pugchihuahua and they always fight and milo follows him around and growls at him and they get into a really aggressive fight this used to happen a while ago but got better for a bit and they wouldnt fight a lot but now its starting to turn more into of a daily thing ive been reading online that milo has signs of anxiety and might be stressed like getting really scared of strangeloud noises  laying in unusual spots by himself and getting angry when someone wants to pick him up sometimes i was wondering if you guys had any info regarding what kind of training or what i can do to help this situation thank you growl

growl my family recently adopted a rescue dog whippet mix he is  years old he gets along with my mom and little brother but not my dad he came back from a trip  weeks after we adopted marshal we had him for about  months now and hes gotten used to the family but whenever my dad wants to pet him he would growl and bark at him if my dads cooking food or eating he isnt scared to be all over him and beg for food nobody in the family had been physical with marshal just the occasional stern command to get off the couch we dont know much about his past other than he came from a hoarding home with  other dogs and was at the shelter for  months before his adoption every now and then on walk he does get intimated by tall beefy men but hes gotten a lot better no longer care 

what can we do for him to get accustomed to my dad how should we train him growl

bark my yr old neutered cockerpoo has started to get agitated not overly aggressive with other dogs 

this is a new thing in the past week he has barked and chased three dogs while out walking hes never done this before as hes always liked to be with other dogs and liked to play 

he stayed with relatives while i was on holiday and they only walk him on lead but since hes been home i walk him as normal hes on lead if other dogs are also on lead and off if others are off his recall is good most of the time as he gets a treatpraise for returning 

im worried that hes suddenly getting annoyed with dogs that are not being aggressive towards him not showing anything but wanting to play 

any help or ideas are much appreciated as he likes to run and i dont want to resort to him being on lead constantly because of his behaviourattitude bark
